channel.title: CVE Feed for Google -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Google -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-2887|2024-06-06T15:28:04.253Z -- google -- chrome
item.description: Type Confusion in WebAssembly in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.86 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

item.title: CVE-2024-5158|2024-06-05T05:15:38.199Z -- google -- chrome
item.description: Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.76 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform arbitrary read/write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

item.title: CVE-2024-2400|2024-03-13T04:09:41.514Z -- google -- chrome
item.description: Use after free in Performance Manager in Google Chrome prior to 122.0.6261.128 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

item.title: CVE-2024-29754|2024-06-06T18:49:15.047Z -- google -- android
item.description: In TMU_IPC_GET_TABLE, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
